title: Write in comments your best support story.
body: Basically i've had alot of people complaining, Cap lock screaming, and toxicity to me about me accidentally failing landing my hooks or making the right play as a support. So i want to see some joy people have had in playing support. What is your favorite moment you've had supporting? Mine from over a hundred games is just them saying "OMG thank you soraka <3" after i saved an ally from dying as a Soraka.

replies.body: Hooked a leona mid E as thresh

As Janna, I once stayed bot lane, while the rest of the team went to other lanes... and for the entirety of the game all I did was shove bot lane- and the enemy team CONSTANTLY tried to surround me and kill me, but they didn't manage to even once... Meanwhile, mid and top got completely pushed and we won the game because everyone on the enemy team was trying so hard to catch the troll Janna in bot lane.

[This, right here.](http://plays.tv/video/55b9572cd7242a89b6)

This was probably the moment that cemented Bard as a favorite of mine.
When i was level 25 i main'd blitzcrank, literally didnt miss a single hook one game, got lucian so fed he bought 4 IE's just for yolo

This is one of those stories that left everyone in the game laughing, and lost us the game horrifically.

We were doing the traditional noob "square off in mid and wait for something to happen" strat, when their {{champion:51}}  stepped in front of her tank line to Q us.

I, being the good {{champion:53}} I was, immediately grabbed the shit out of her and destroyed her and her team. Just kidding. Their {{champion:32}} {{summoner:4}} Infront of her just as my hook was flying and he saved her life. Now we all know what happens when {{champion:53}} hooks {{champion:32}} in a situation like this, and needless to say we did not win fight. 

but we were all laughing so hard from that play, we all honored {{champion:32}} after the game simply because that was such an amazing play.


As for good plays, does a {{champion:40}} Q over dragon wall killing 2 people and the dragon count?

My best support game came at a horrible time in league in season 3 towards the end but right before support utility changes. We had a Tristana who was lagging and really could not do much, a Lux who consistently DCed every 3 mins and a Nasus and Mundo. I saw Mundo and Nasus were doing ok so I prioritized shielding on them. We carried the game together, Mundo and Nasus with my Shield could take on the whole team. Yes, I went full ap.

hmm. playing {{champion:267}} ...got first blood with ignite. come back to lane and get two more kills while trying to hand them over...well fuck. Fate has smiled upon me. 
Buy {{item:3041}} , never return to bot lane. Go full AP {{item:3089}} {{item:3174}} {{item:3157}}{{item:1326}}  ...{{item:3041}} fully stacked by about 20 mins. Start soloing their top and mid laners. 

felt good man
......
also, stealing dragon with {{champion:40}} Q & {{champion:201}} Q. done this a few times. even more WTF when their jungler is present. :)

I refer you, to this.
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/memes/dhWcbw73-when-you-as-janna-somehow-manage-to-save-the-adc-from-3-assassins-and-a-turret

But yeah, stopping Rengar mid air with the Q, flash-ulting Kat out from under the turret while also stopping her ult, shielding MF at the last possible second to save her from that last turret shot (Admittedly, the Talon sucked)... No credit... But the moment was satisfying.
Either when I stole baron with Nami r max range or when I 2v5 the enemy team with my malphite teammate only to get him a penta
stole a penta as blitz support, my team loved me for it
Stole Baron with Braum Q without having vision...

I was Leona, and I was supporting for a Kog'Maw. Top, jungle and mid weren't doing much, so we got first blood, and then a triple when the enemy Tryndamere came and ganked at level 5. The enemy team surrendered at 20.

I don't remember if I got any praise for it, but I'm still very proud of it.

My favorite stories from my experience is when I do get one of those few abusive ADCs and they die twice early and just start raging. Then I just type in chat "Alright, you seem to have bot lane under control sir. Who wants me to get them kills?" and mid and the jungler jump all over that offer.

I love those games. So many dragons. So many assists. So many towers. Meanwhile, the ADC is now 0/4/0 or worse and hasn't said since.

Very rare games, but even if I lose, it is just so satisfying leaving an asshole and making progress elsewhere.
